channel.title: The other idea
channel.description:
Alright, so I'm not a huge fan of the new plugin. But I think there is another way. Currently on a survival server it isn't that hard to survive all you need to do is mine a few blocks, gain access to coal and you're safe.
But I think this should be made harder. It can include:
The readding of creeper explosions Possible increased spawn rate etc...
This way it would just be like on the first map, people would work together and help each other instead of killing each other all the time to gain immense wealth. This would of course lead to the possible deactivation of Pvp.
Some may argue a map reset would be in order, but it is still possible to be done if we all move close to each other.
Opinions?
EDIT: Added a poll.

item.title: The other idea
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Re-adding creeper explosions is no problem and can be done easily (but keep in mind, if it is used to grief by luring or something else, it can’t be un-done by big brother).

I don’t know what if anything can be done about the spawn rate or difficulty, but I certainly wouldn’t mind looking into it.

@The map reset, you all know I promised I wouldn’t do this again, but I wouldn’t mind moving the spawn point someplace far off, and even enabling /spawn for a time so that people who want to can meet up to do whatever you want.

Are you also talking about disabling PvP? I tend to prefer maybe allowing people who want to use the residency plugin to disable PvP in their own towns, so that towns can optionally become ‘pvp free zones’, and the rest would be like the wilderness. That seems to be basically like real life not too awful long ago, in any place with few people, vast land, and virtually unlimited resources.

So basically, I wouldn’t mind doing the first few things, but I also think PvP and the residency plugin is a good idea. (PS. People don’t live far away from each other because PvP is enabled, they do it because of the griefers, which residency would stop)
